   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: %% Originally based on Per Gustafsson's test suite.
   21: %%
   22: 
   23: -module(bs_bincomp_no_copt_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   27:          verify_highest_opcode/1,
   28: 	 byte_aligned/1,bit_aligned/1,extended_byte_aligned/1,
   29: 	 extended_bit_aligned/1,mixed/1,filters/1,trim_coverage/1,
   30: 	 nomatch/1,sizes/1,general_expressions/1,
   31:          no_generator/1,zero_pattern/1,multiple_segments/1,
   32:          grab_bag/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   37: 
   38: all() ->
   39:     [verify_highest_opcode,
   40:      byte_aligned, bit_aligned, extended_byte_aligned,
   41:      extended_bit_aligned, mixed, filters, trim_coverage,
   42:      nomatch, sizes, general_expressions,
   43:      no_generator, zero_pattern, multiple_segments,
   44:      grab_bag].
   45: 
   46: groups() ->
   47:     [].
   48: 
   49: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   57: 	Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60: 	Config.
   61: 
   62: verify_highest_opcode(_Config) ->
   63:     case ?MODULE of
   64:         bs_bincomp_r25_SUITE ->
   65:             {ok,Beam} = file:read_file(code:which(?MODULE)),
   66:             case test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam) of
   67:                 Highest when Highest =< 180 ->
   68:                     ok;
   69:                 TooHigh ->
   70:                     ct:fail({too_high_opcode,TooHigh})
   71:             end;
   72:         _ ->
   73:             ok
   74:     end.
   75: 
   76: byte_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   77:     cs_init(),
   78:     <<"abcdefg">> = cs(<< <<(X+32)>> || <<X>> <= <<"ABCDEFG">> >>),
   79:     <<"AxyzBxyzCxyz">> = cs(<< <<X, "xyz">> || <<X>> <= <<"ABC">> >>),
   80:     <<1:32/little,2:32/little,3:32/little,4:32/little>> =
   81: 	cs(<< <<X:32/little>> || <<X:32>> <= <<1:32,2:32,3:32,4:32>> >>),
   82:     cs(<<1:32/little,2:32/little,3:32/little,4:32/little>> =
   83: 	   << <<X:32/little>> || <<X:16>> <= <<1:16,2:16,3:16,4:16>> >>),
   84:     cs_end().
   85: 
   86: bit_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   87:     cs_init(),
   88:     <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>> =
   89: 	cs(<< <<(X+32):7>> || <<X>> <= <<"ABCDEFG">> >>),
   90:     <<"ABCDEFG">> = cs(<< <<(X-32)>> || <<X:7>> <= id(<<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>>) >>),
   91:     <<1:31/little,2:31/little,3:31/little,4:31/little>> =
   92: 	cs(<< <<X:31/little>> || <<X:31>> <= <<1:31,2:31,3:31,4:31>> >>),
   93:     <<1:31/little,2:31/little,3:31/little,4:31/little>> =
   94: 	cs(<< <<X:31/little>> || <<X:15>> <= <<1:15,2:15,3:15,4:15>> >>),
   95:     cs_end().
   96: 
   97: extended_byte_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     cs_init(),
   99:     <<"abcdefg">> = cs(<< <<(X+32)>> || X <- "ABCDEFG" >>),
  100:     "abcdefg" = [(X+32) || <<X>> <= <<"ABCDEFG">>],
  101:     <<1:32/little,2:32/little,3:32/little,4:32/little>> =
  102: 	cs(<< <<X:32/little>> || X <- [1,2,3,4] >>),
  103:     [256,512,768,1024] =
  104: 	[X || <<X:16/little>> <= <<1:16,2:16,3:16,4:16>>],
  105:     cs_end().
  106: 
  107: extended_bit_aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     cs_init(),
  109:     <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>> =
  110: 	cs(<< <<(X+32):7>> || X <- "ABCDEFG" >>),
  111:     "ABCDEFG" = [(X-32) || <<X:7>> <= <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>>],
  112:     <<1:31/little,2:31/little,3:31/little,4:31/little>> =
  113: 	cs(<< <<X:31/little>> || X <- [1,2,3,4] >>),
  114:     [256,512,768,1024] =
  115: 	[X || <<X:15/little>> <= <<1:15,2:15,3:15,4:15>>],
  116:     cs_end().
  117: 
  118: mixed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     cs_init(),
  120:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  121: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, <<Y>> <= <<1,2>> >>),
  122:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  123: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, Y <- [1,2] >>),
  124:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  125: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || X <- [1,2,3,4], Y <- [1,2] >>),
  126:     One = id([1,2,3,4]),
  127:     Two = id([1,2]),
  128:     <<2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6>> =
  129: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y)>> || X <- One, Y <- Two >>),
  130:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  131: 	[(X+Y) || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, <<Y>> <= <<1,2>>],
  132:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  133: 	[(X+Y) || <<X>> <= <<1,2,3,4>>, Y <- [1,2]],
  134:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  135: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>,
  136:                               <<Y:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3>> >>),
  137:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  138: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>, Y <- [1,2] >>),
  139:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  140: 	cs(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || X <- [1,2,3,4], Y <- [1,2] >>),
  141:     <<2:3,3:3,3:3,4:3,4:3,5:3,5:3,6:3>> =
  142: 	cs_default(<< <<(X+Y):3>> || {X,Y} <- [{1,1},{1,2},{2,1},{2,2},
  143:                                                {3,1},{3,2},{4,1},{4,2}] >>),
  144:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  145: 	[(X+Y) || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>, <<Y:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3>>],
  146:     [2,3,3,4,4,5,5,6] =
  147: 	[(X+Y) || <<X:3>> <= <<1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3>>, {_,Y} <- [{a,1},{b,2}]],
  148: 
  149:     %% OTP-16899: Nested binary comprehensions would fail to load.
  150:     <<0,1,0,2,0,3,99>> = mixed_nested([1,2,3]),
  151: 
  152:     <<1>> = cs_default(<< <<X>> || L <- [[1]], X <- L >>),
  153: 
  154:     %% The compiler would crash in v3_kernel.
  155:     <<42:32,75:32,253:32,(42 bsl 8 bor 75):32>> =
  156:         cs_default(mixed_size(id([8,16]), <<42,75,253>>)),
  157: 
  158:     silly_lc_bc(5),
  159: 
  160:     gen_data(0),
  161:     gen_data(256),
  162:     gen_data(512),
  163: 
  164:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(match_context_1(<<1,2,3>>)),
  165:     <<4,5,6>> = cs_default(match_context_2(<<4,5,6>>)),
  166: 
  167:     <<255>> = over_complex_generator(),
  168:     {'EXIT',_} = catch float_segment_size(),
  169: 
  170:     <<>> = inconsistent_types_1([]),
  171:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,42},_}} = catch inconsistent_types_1(42),
  172:     Self = self(),
  173:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,Self},_}} = catch inconsistent_types_1(Self),
  174: 
  175:     {'EXIT',{{bad_filter,<<>>},_}} = catch inconsistent_types_2(),
  176: 
  177:     %% Cover some code in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  178:     [] = fun(A) ->
  179:                  [] = [ok || <<A:A, _:(A bsr 1)>> <= A]
  180:          end(id(<<>>)),
  181: 
  182:     cs_end().
  183: 
  184: 
  185: mixed_nested(L) ->
  186:     << << << << E:16 >> || E <- L >> || true >>/binary, 99:(id(8))>>.
  187: 
  188: mixed_size(List, Bin) ->
  189:     << <<X:32>> || Size <- List, <<X:Size>> <= Bin >>.
  190: 
  191: silly_lc_bc(N) when N > 0 ->
  192:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(silly_lc(N)),
  193:     Bin = cs(silly_bc(N)),
  194:     Size = byte_size(Bin),
  195:     Size = 5 bsl N,
  196:     silly_lc_bc(N - 1);
  197: silly_lc_bc(_) -> ok.
  198: 
  199: silly_bc(0) ->
  200:     <<0, 1, 2, 3, 4>>;
  201: silly_bc(N) ->
  202:     << <<X, X>> || <<X>> <= silly_bc(N - 1) >>.
  203: 
  204: silly_lc(0) ->
  205:     [0, 1, 2, 3, 4];
  206: silly_lc(N) ->
  207:     [[X, X] || X <- silly_lc(N - 1)].
  208: 
  209: gen_data(Size) ->
  210:     Data = cs(<< <<C>> || C <- lists:seq(0, Size-1) >>),
  211:     Data = << <<C>> || _ <- lists:seq(1, Size div 256),
  212:                        C <- lists:seq(0, 255) >>.
  213: 
  214: match_context_1(<<B/binary>>) ->
  215:     << <<V>> || <<V>> <= B >>.
  216: 
  217: match_context_2(<<B/binary>>) ->
  218:     do_match_context_2(B).
  219: 
  220: do_match_context_2(B) ->
  221:     << <<V>> || <<V>> <= B >>.
  222: 
  223: %% Would crash beam_ssa_bc_size when the no_copt option was given.
  224: over_complex_generator() ->
  225:     <<
  226:       <<255>> ||
  227:         <<0:2>> <= <<0:2>>,
  228:         <<_:8>> <=
  229:             case true of
  230:                 true ->
  231:                     <<8>>;
  232:                 [6.6 | bad_tail] ->
  233:                     ok;
  234:                 [3 | 4] ->
  235:                     error
  236:             end
  237:     >>.
  238: 
  239: float_segment_size() ->
  240:     try
  241:         V = 0.79
  242:     of
  243:         _ ->
  244:             %% Would crash beam_ssa_bc_size when trying to
  245:             %% interpret V * U = 0.79 * 8 as a size.
  246:             <<
  247:               0 || <<5.9:V/unit:8-float>> <= 42
  248:             >>
  249:     catch
  250:         _:_ ->
  251:             error
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: %% GH-6468. Would crash in beam_ssa_bc_size:update_successors/3.
  255: inconsistent_types_1(X) ->
  256:     <<
  257:       X || _ <- X,
  258:            case is_pid(X) of
  259:                Y ->
  260:                    (#{
  261:                         ((not Y) andalso
  262:                          <<Y:(Y andalso X)>>) := Y
  263:                      } = X);
  264:                _ ->
  265:                    false
  266:            end
  267:     >>.
  268: 
  269: %% GH-6468. Same type of crash.
  270: inconsistent_types_2() ->
  271:     <<
  272:       0 || case id([]) of
  273:                Y ->
  274:                    <<
  275:                      Y ||
  276:                        _ <- Y,
  277:                        (not ((false = Y) = (Y /= []))), (_ = Y)
  278:                    >>
  279:            end
  280:     >>.
  281: 
  282: filters(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  283:     cs_init(),
  284:     <<"BDF">> =
  285: 	cs_default(<< <<(X-32)>> ||
  286: 		       <<X:7>> <= <<$a:7,$b:7,$c:7,$d:7,$e:7,$f:7,$g:7>>,
  287: 		       X rem 2 == 0>>),
  288:     <<"abc">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  289: 			       X <- "ABCDEFG",
  290: 			       is_less_than(X, $D)>>),
  291:     <<"efg">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  292: 			       X <- "ABCDEFG",
  293: 			       not is_less_than(X, $E)>>),
  294:     <<"b">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  295: 			     X <- "ABCDEFG",
  296: 			     is_less_than(X, $D),
  297: 			     X rem 2 == 0>>),
  298:     <<"eg">> = cs_default(<< <<(X+32)>> ||
  299: 			      X <- "ABCDEFG",
  300: 			      not is_less_than(X, $E),
  301: 			      X rem 2 == 1>>),
  302:     <<1,3>> = cs_default(<< <<(length(L))>> ||
  303:                              L <- [[],[a],[],[x,y,z]],
  304:                              case L of
  305:                                  [] -> false;
  306:                                  [_|_] -> true
  307:                              end >>),
  308:     <<77,42>> = cs_default(<< <<B>> || <<B>> <- [<<77>>,<<1,2>>,<<42>>] >>),
  309: 
  310:     %% Filtering by a non-matching pattern.
  311:     <<"abd">> = cs_default(<< <<X:8>> ||
  312: 			       <<0:1,X:7>> <= <<$a:8,$b:8,1:1,$c:7,$d:8,
  313: 						1:1,$e:7,0:4>> >>),
  314: 
  315:     <<42,42>> = cs_default(<< <<42:8>> || 42 <- [1,2,3,42,43,42] >>),
  316:     cs_end().
  317: 
  318: is_less_than(X, C) when X < C -> true;
  319: is_less_than(_, _) -> false.
  320: 
  321: trim_coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     <<0,0,0,2,0,0,5,48,0,11,219,174,0,0,0,0>> = coverage_materialiv(a, b, {1328,777134}),
  323:     <<67,40,0,0,66,152,0,0,69,66,64,0>> = coverage_trimmer([42,19,777]),
  324:     <<0,0,2,43,0,0,3,9,0,0,0,3,64,8,0,0,0,0,0,0,
  325: 	   64,68,0,0,0,0,0,0,192,171,198,0,0,0,0,0>> = 
  326: 	coverage_lightfv(555, 777, {3.0,40.0,-3555.0}),
  327:     <<"abcabc">> = coverage_strange(0, <<"abc">>),
  328:     ok.
  329: 
  330: coverage_materialiv(A, B, Params) ->
  331:     A = id(A),
  332:     B = id(B),
  333:     <<(tuple_size(Params)):32,
  334:      (<< <<C:32>> || C <- tuple_to_list(Params)>>)/binary,
  335:      0:(((1+tuple_size(Params)) rem 2)*32)>>.
  336: 
  337: coverage_lightfv(Light, Pname, Params) ->
  338:     id(<<Light:32,Pname:32,(size(Params)):32,
  339: 	(<< <<C:64/float>> || C <- tuple_to_list(Params)>>)/binary,
  340: 	0:(((1+size(Params)) rem 2)*32)>>).
  341: 
  342: coverage_trimmer(Params) ->
  343:     X = id(0),
  344:     Y = id(1),
  345:     id({X,Y}),
  346:     << <<(begin {A,B,D} = id({C,C,C}), id(0),
  347: 		coverage_summer(A, B, C, D) end):32/float>> ||
  348: 	C <- Params >>.
  349: 
  350: coverage_summer(A, B, C, D) -> A+B+C+D.
  351: 
  352: coverage_strange(V, Bin) ->
  353:     <<
  354:       << <<X>> || <<X/utf8>> <= Bin >>/bits,
  355:       << <<Y>> || <<Y>> <= Bin>>:
  356:       case V of
  357:           V ->
  358:               3;
  359:           0 ->
  360:               receive
  361:                   whatever ->
  362:                       1
  363:               end
  364:       end/bytes>>.
  365: 
  366: nomatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  367:     Bin = id(<<1,2,3,4,5>>),
  368:     <<>> = << <<X:8>> || X = {_,_} = [_|_] <- [1,2,3] >>,
  369:     [] = [X || <<X:all/binary>> <= Bin],
  370:     [] = [X || <<X:bad/binary>> <= Bin],
  371:     <<>> = << <<X:32>> || <<X:all/binary>> <= Bin >>,
  372:     <<>> = << <<X:32>> || <<X:bad/binary>> <= Bin >>,
  373: 
  374:     <<>> = << <<"a">> || <<_:1/float>> <= Bin>>,
  375: 
  376:     NaN = <<(-1):32>>,
  377:     <<>> = << <<"a">> || <<_:32/float>> <= NaN >>,
  378: 
  379:     <<1:32,2:32,3:32>> = nomatch_1(<<1,2,3>>, 8),
  380:     <<>> = nomatch_1(<<1,2,3>>, bad),
  381: 
  382:     <<>> = << <<>> || <<_:8>> <= <<>> >>,
  383: 
  384:     %% GH-7494. Qualifiers should be evaluated from left to right. The
  385:     %% second (failing) generator should never be evaluated because the
  386:     %% first generator is an empty list.
  387:     <<>> = id(<< <<C:8>> || C <- [], _ <- ok >>),
  388:     <<>> = id(<<0 || _ <- [], _ <- ok, false>>),
  389: 
  390:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,false},_}} = catch << [] || <<0:0>> <= false >>,
  391: 
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: nomatch_1(Bin, Size) ->
  395:     << <<X:32>> || <<X:Size>> <= Bin >>.
  396: 
  397: sizes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     cs_init(),
  399:     Fun0 = fun(List) ->
  400: 		   cs(<< <<E:8>> || E <- List >>)
  401: 	   end,
  402:     <<>> = Fun0([]),
  403:     <<1>> = Fun0([1]),
  404:     <<1,2>> = Fun0([1,2]),
  405:     <<1,2,3>> = Fun0([1,2,3]),
  406: 
  407:     Fun1 = fun(List) ->
  408: 		   cs(<< <<E:16>> || E <- List >>)
  409: 	   end,
  410:     <<>> = Fun1([]),
  411:     <<1:16>> = Fun1([1]),
  412:     <<1:16,2:16>> = Fun1([1,2]),
  413:     <<1:16,2:16,3:16>> = Fun1([1,2,3]),
  414: 
  415:     Fun2 = fun(List) ->
  416: 		   cs(<< <<E:4>> || E <- List >>)
  417: 	   end,
  418:     <<>> = Fun2([]),
  419:     <<1:4>> = Fun2([1]),
  420:     <<1:4,13:4>> = Fun2([1,13]),
  421:     <<1:4,13:4,7:4>> = Fun2([1,13,7]),
  422:     <<0:1000/unit:8>> = Fun2(lists:duplicate(2000, 0)),
  423: 
  424:     Fun3 = fun(List) ->
  425: 		   cs(<< <<E:3>> || E <- List >>)
  426: 	   end,
  427:     <<>> = Fun3([]),
  428:     <<40,177,29:5>> = Fun3([1,2,1,3,0,7,5]),
  429:     <<0:512/unit:3>> = Fun3(lists:duplicate(512, 0)),
  430: 
  431:     Fun4 = fun(List, Size) ->
  432: 		   cs(<< <<E:Size>> || E <- List >>)
  433: 	   end,
  434:     <<>> = Fun4([], 8),
  435:     <<42:6>> = Fun4([42], 6),
  436:     <<42:16>> = Fun4([42], 16),
  437: 
  438:     Fun5 = fun(List, Sz1, Sz2, Sz3) ->
  439: 		   cs(<< <<E:Sz1,(E+1):Sz2/unit:8,(E+2):Sz3/unit:8>> || E <- List >>)
  440: 	   end,
  441:     <<>> = Fun5([], 1, 1, 1),
  442:     <<7:3,8:40,9:56>> = Fun5([7], 3, 5, 7),
  443: 
  444:     Fun5a = fun(List, Sz1, Sz2, Sz3) ->
  445:                     cs(<< <<"abc",E:Sz1,(E+1):Sz2/unit:8,"qqq",(E+2):Sz3/unit:8,"xyz">> ||
  446:                           E <- List >>)
  447: 	   end,
  448:     <<>> = Fun5a([], 1, 1, 1),
  449:     <<"abc",7:3,8:40,"qqq",9:56,"xyz">> = Fun5a([7], 3, 5, 7),
  450: 
  451:     Fun6 = fun(List, Size) ->
  452: 		   cs(<< <<E:8,(E+1):Size>> || E <- List >>)
  453: 	   end,
  454:     <<>> = Fun6([], 42),
  455:     <<42,43:20>> = Fun6([42], 20),
  456: 
  457:     Fun7 = fun(B) ->
  458:                    cs_default(<< <<C/utf8>> || C <- B >>)
  459:             end,
  460:     <<"Foundation"/utf8>> = Fun7("Foundation"),
  461:     <<"Основание"/utf8>> = Fun7("Основание"),
  462: 
  463:     %% Binary generators.
  464: 
  465:     Fun10 = fun(Bin) ->
  466: 		    cs(<< <<E:16>> || <<E:8>> <= id(Bin) >>)
  467:             end,
  468:     <<>> = Fun10(<<>>),
  469:     <<1:16>> = Fun10(<<1>>),
  470:     <<1:16,2:16>> = Fun10(<<1,2>>),
  471: 
  472:     Fun11 = fun(Bin) ->
  473: 		    cs(<< <<E:8>> || <<E:16>> <= id(Bin) >>)
  474:             end,
  475:     <<>> = Fun11(<<>>),
  476:     <<1>> = Fun11(<<1:16>>),
  477:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16>>),
  478:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,0:1>>),
  479:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,0:7>>),
  480:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,42:8>>),
  481:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,42:9>>),
  482:     <<1,2>> = Fun11(<<1:16,2:16,255:15>>),
  483: 
  484:     Fun12 = fun(Bin, Sz1, Sz2) ->
  485: 		    cs(<< <<E:Sz1>> || <<E:Sz2>> <= id(Bin) >>)
  486: 	    end,
  487:     <<>> = Fun12(<<>>, 1, 1),
  488:     Binary = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),
  489:     Binary = Fun12(Binary, 1, 1),
  490:     Binary = Fun12(Binary, 4, 4),
  491:     Binary = Fun12(Binary, 8, 8),
  492:     <<17:9,19:9>> = Fun12(<<17:6,19:6>>, 9, 6),
  493: 
  494:     Fun13 = fun(Sz) ->
  495: 		    cs(<< <<C:8>> || <<C:4>> <= <<1:4,2:4,3:4,0:Sz>> >>)
  496:    	    end,
  497:     <<1,2,3>> = Fun13(0),
  498:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(4),
  499:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(5),
  500:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(6),
  501:     <<1,2,3,0>> = Fun13(7),
  502:     <<1,2,3,0,0>> = Fun13(8),
  503: 
  504:     <<0:3>> = cs_default(<< <<0:S>> || S <- [0,1,2] >>),
  505:     <<0:3>> = cs_default(<< <<0:S>> || <<S>> <= <<0,1,2>> >>),
  506: 
  507:     Fun14 = fun(L, B) ->
  508:                     cs_default(<< <<X:32>> || Size <- L, <<X:Size>> <= B >>)
  509:             end,
  510:     <<$a:32,$b:32,$c:32,($a bsl 8 bor $b):32>> = Fun14([8,16], <<"abc">>),
  511:     <<$a:32,$b:32,$c:32>> = Fun14([8,bad], <<"abc">>),
  512: 
  513:     Fun15 = fun(B) ->
  514:                     cs_default(<< <<C/utf8>> || << C:32 >> <= id(B) >>)
  515:             end,
  516:     <<"Foundation"/utf8>> = Fun15(<<"Foundation"/utf32>>),
  517:     <<"Основание"/utf8>> = Fun15(<<"Основание"/utf32>>),
  518: 
  519:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch << <<C:4>> || <<C:8>> <= {1,2,3} >>),
  520: 
  521:     cs_end(),
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: -define(BAD(E),   {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch << (E) || _ <- [1,2,3] >>)).
  525: -define(BAD_V(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch << (E) || I <- [1,2,3] >>)).
  526: 
  527: general_expressions(_) ->
  528:     cs_init(),
  529: 
  530:     <<1,2,3>> = cs(<< begin <<1,2,3>> end || _ <- [1] >>),
  531:     <<"abc">> = cs(<< begin <<"abc">> end || _ <- [1] >>),
  532:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(<< begin
  533:                                   I = <<(I0+1)>>,
  534:                                   id(I)
  535:                               end || <<I0>> <= <<0,1,2>> >>),
  536:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(<< I || I <- [<<1,2>>,<<3>>] >>),
  537:     <<1,2,3>> = cs_default(<< (id(<<I>>)) || I <- [1,2,3] >>),
  538:     <<2,4>> = cs_default(<< case I rem 2 of
  539:                                 0 -> <<I>>;
  540:                                 1 -> <<>>
  541:                             end || I <- [1,2,3,4,5] >>),
  542:     <<2,3,4,5,6,7>> = cs_default(<< << (id(<<J>>)) || J <- [2*I,2*I+1] >> ||
  543:                                      I <- [1,2,3] >>),
  544:     <<1,2,2,3,4,4>> = cs_default(<< if
  545:                                         I rem 2 =:= 0 -> <<I,I>>;
  546:                                         true -> <<I>>
  547:                                     end || I <- [1,2,3,4] >>),
  548:     self() ! <<42>>,
  549:     <<42>> = cs_default(<< receive B -> B end || _ <- [1] >>),
  550:     <<10,5,3>> = cs_default(<< try
  551:                                    <<(10 div I)>>
  552:                                catch _:_ ->
  553:                                        <<>>
  554:                                end || I <- [0,1,2,3] >>),
  555: 
  556:     <<3:4,16#A:4,7:4>> = cs(hstring_to_bitstring("3A7")),
  557:     <<0:3,1:3,2:3,3:3,4:3,5:3,6:3,7:3>> = cs(encode_chars_compact_map("ABCDEFGH", id(3), id({$A,8}))),
  558: 
  559:     cs_end(),
  560: 
  561:     %% Failing expressions.
  562:     ?BAD(bad_atom),
  563:     ?BAD(42),
  564:     ?BAD(42.0),
  565:     ?BAD_V({ok,I}),
  566:     ?BAD_V([I]),
  567:     ?BAD_V(fun() -> I end),
  568: 
  569:     ok.
  570: 
  571: hstring_to_bitstring(L) ->
  572:     << <<(hex_to_int(D)):4>> || D <- L >>.
  573: 
  574: hex_to_int(D) when $0 =< D, D =< $9 -> D - $0;
  575: hex_to_int(D) when $A =< D, D =< $F -> D - ($A - 10).
  576: 
  577: encode_chars_compact_map(Val, NumBits, {Lb,Limit}) ->
  578:     << <<(enc_char_cm(C, Lb, Limit)):NumBits>> || C <- Val >>.
  579: 
  580: enc_char_cm(C0, Lb, Limit) ->
  581:     C = C0 - Lb,
  582:     if
  583: 	0 =< C, C < Limit ->
  584: 	    C;
  585: 	true ->
  586:             error(illegal)
  587:     end.
  588: 
  589: -undef(BAD).
  590: 
  591: no_generator(_Config) ->
  592:     [<<"abc">>] = [<<(id(<<"abc">>)) || true >>],
  593:     {<<>>} = {<<(id(<<"abc">>)) || false >>},
  594: 
  595:     %% Would crash the compiler when compiled with +no_type_opt.
  596:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch << (catch "\001") || true >>),
  597: 
  598:     ok.
  599: 
  600: zero_pattern(Config) ->
  601:     case is_atom(Config) of
  602:         true ->
  603:             %% Patterns that match zero bits loops forever, so we must
  604:             %% be careful not to execute them.
  605:             _ = << <<>> || <<>> <= <<>> >>,
  606:             _ = << <<42>> || <<>> <= <<42>> >>,
  607:             _ = <<
  608:                   <<>> ||
  609:                     <<>> <= << >>,
  610:                     <<3:back>> <= << >>
  611:                 >>,
  612:             _ = <<
  613:                   <<>> ||
  614:                     <<>> <= <<>>,
  615:                     <<>> <- << <<>> || area >>
  616:                 >>;
  617:         false ->
  618:             ok
  619:     end.
  620: 
  621: multiple_segments(_Config) ->
  622:     cs_init(),
  623: 
  624:     [1,2] = matched_out_size(<<4, 1:4, 4, 2:4>>),
  625:     [42] = matched_out_size(<<16, 42:16, 72>>),
  626: 
  627:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<>>),
  628:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<1>>),
  629:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<1,2>>),
  630:     [] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<1,2,3>>),
  631:     [1,4] = do_multiple_segments_1(<<99,0,1,1,2,3,4,4>>),
  632: 
  633:     [] = do_multiple_segments_2(<<1,2>>),
  634:     [6] = do_multiple_segments_2(<<1,2,3>>),
  635:     [6,15] = do_multiple_segments_2(<<1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8>>),
  636: 
  637:     cs_end(),
  638:     ok.
  639: 
  640: matched_out_size(Gen) ->
  641:     Bin = cs_default(<< <<X>> || <<S,X:S>> <= Gen >>),
  642:     List = [X || <<S,X:S>> <= Gen],
  643:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  644:     List.
  645: 
  646: do_multiple_segments_1(Gen) ->
  647:     Bin = cs_default(<< <<V>> || <<V,V>> <= Gen >>),
  648:     List = [V || <<V,V>> <= Gen],
  649:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  650:     List.
  651: 
  652: do_multiple_segments_2(Gen) ->
  653:     Bin = cs(<< <<(A+B+C)>> || <<A,B,C>> <= Gen >>),
  654:     List = [A+B+C || <<A,B,C>> <= Gen],
  655:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  656:     List.
  657: 
  658: grab_bag(_Config) ->
  659:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch grab_bag_gh_6553(<<>>),
  660:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch grab_bag_gh_6553(a),
  661:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,<<>>},_}} = catch grab_bag_gh_6553(<<42>>),
  662: 
  663:     %% Cover a line v3_kernel:get_line/1.
  664:     _ = catch << ok || <<>> <= ok, ok >>,
  665: 
  666:     ok.
  667: 
  668: grab_bag_gh_6553(<<X>>) ->
  669:     %% Would crash in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  670:     <<X, ((<<_:0>> = <<_>>) = <<>>)>>.
  671: 
  672: cs_init() ->
  673:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  674:     ok.
  675: 
  676: cs_end() ->
  677:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  678:     ok.
  679: 
  680: %% Verify that the allocated size is exact (rounded up to the nearest byte).
  681: cs(Bin) ->
  682:     case ?MODULE of
  683:         bs_bincomp_cover_SUITE ->
  684:             ok;
  685:         bs_bincomp_no_opt_SUITE ->
  686:             ok;
  687:         bs_bincomp_no_ssa_opt_SUITE ->
  688:             ok;
  689:         bs_bincomp_no_copt_SUITE ->
  690:             ok;
  691:         bs_bincomp_no_copt_ssa_SUITE ->
  692:             ok;
  693:         bs_bincomp_post_opt_SUITE ->
  694:             ok;
  695:         bs_bincomp_r25_SUITE ->
  696:             ok;
  697:         bs_bincomp_r26_SUITE ->
  698:             ok;
  699:         _ ->
  700:             ByteSize = byte_size(Bin),
  701:             {refc_binary,ByteSize,{binary,ByteSize},_} =
  702:                 erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin})
  703:     end,
  704:     Bin.
  705: 
  706: %% Verify that the allocated size of the binary is the default size.
  707: cs_default(Bin) ->
  708:     ByteSize = byte_size(Bin),
  709:     {refc_binary,ByteSize,{binary,256},_} = 
  710: 	erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin}),
  711:     Bin.
  712: 
  713: id(I) -> I.
